transcript: Olmiitz, dined there, drank a bottle of wine, and then set off alone to the Guards' camp to find his old playmate. Rost6v had not yet had time to get his uniform. He had on a shabby cadet jacket, decorated with a soldier's cross, equally shabby cadet's riding breeches lined with worn leather, and an of- ficer's saber with a sword knot. The Don horse he was riding was one he had bought from a Cossack during the campaign, and he wore a crumpled hussar cap stuck jauntily back on one side of
